SEARCH

Class Plant

java.lang.Object
Plant
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Plant extends Object implements Runnable
The Plant class represents a processing plant in which workers bottle oranges. Using several threads and different queues, the plant has different Worker objects who do one of three tasks:
1. Peel oranges
2. Squeeze oranges
3. Bottle oranges
The workers receive and pass on oranges using LinkedBlockingQueue.

    Offers an orange to the peelQueue, if full, it will wait 100 milliseconds to add one.
    int
    getOrangesBottled()
    Gets the number of oranges bottled, which is the size of the doneQueue ( Oranges fully processed) divided by the constant ORANGES_PER_BOTTLE.
    int

    Gets the number of oranges left in all queues besides the doneQueue.
    int

    Gets the number of oranges not bottled, which is the length of the doneQueue mod ORANGES_PER_BOTTLE.
    int
    getOrangesProcessed()
    Gets the number of oranges processed, which is the length of the doneQueue.
    int
    getOrangesProvided()
    Gets the number of oranges provided to workers.
    int
    getOrangesRemovedFromQueues()
    Gets how many oranges were removed from queues because they were in the wrong one.
    int
    getOrangesWasted()
    Gets the number of oranges wasted, which is the number of oranges not bottled and the number of oranges left in queues other than the doneQueue.

      public void stopPlant()
      Sets timeToWork to false.

    • waitToStop

      public void waitToStop()
      Waits for thread to stop. Calls waitToStop on each worker before waiting to stop itself.
      From stack overflow :
      The classic implementation of Thread.join is to lock the Thread object, test to see if is alive and if not wait on the Thread object. As a thread exits, it locks its instance and calls notifyAll.

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs thread until it is no longer time to work. Continues to create oranges and distribute them.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • checkQueues

      public void checkQueues()
      The Line Inspector, removes oranges from each queue if they are not in the correct Orange.State.
      • Removes oranges from peelQueue who's state isn't fetched.
      • Removes oranges from squeezeQueue who's state isn't peeled.
      • Removes oranges from bottleQueue who's state isn't squeezed.
      • Removes oranges from doneQueue who's state isn't bottled.

    • distributeOrange

      public void distributeOrange(Orange o)
      Offers an orange to the peelQueue, if full, it will wait 100 milliseconds to add one.
      Parameters:
      o - Orange to process
